title: Webquest 'trip to London'
description: As a school we are organizing a trip to London. To prepare the students for this trip they can do this webquest in order to learn more about the city.

items.content: Soon our school is organizing a trip to London. Your class is joining in this trip. As you know there is a schedule of activities we are going to do. We will visit many interesting locations and participate in some exciting activities. For example; we are going to visit Buckingham Palace. The changing of the guard is a world famous tradition you can't miss when visiting London.

Soon our school is organizing a trip to London. Your class is joining in this trip. As you know there is a schedule of activities we are going to do. We will visit many interesting locations and participate in some exciting activities. For example; we are going to visit Tower bridge

In order to enjoy your visit to London as much as possible we advise you to be well prepared. Collect information about the city and its history and culture, relevant for your trip. Search the internet using the links given by your teacher.

Because it is too much to search for everything about London you have to choose one topic on which you have to find more information. As a group you have to present this topic to your class so they know all about this topic as well. You can choose your own way of presenting.

Task 1

Goal of task 1 is to gather the relevant information using ICT and to exchange information in a group (transform).

  • This task you have to do in a group of four students.
  • Each group is divided in two pairs.
  • Each pair has to fill in one of the two quizzes about London.
  • Both pairs collect the information on the internet (sites are provided).
  • Answer the questions in the quiz.
  • Discuss the answers on the questions within the group. (Exchanging information)
  • Choose one of the topics you find most interesting as a group. Coordinate this topic with your teacher in order to avoid the same topic being presented more often.

Task 2

Goal of task 2 is to present your topic as a group to the rest of the class. As a group you have to make sure everyone does an equal part of work (product to be designed is the presentation).

  • Make a presentation. You can choose the way of presenting as a group (presentation, poster, menu, etcetera)
  • Focus on one specific topic.
  • Explain your way of presenting in class.
  • Divide the roles among the members of your group:

Design expert; person who designs the poster or PowerPoint presentation.

Language Expert; person who writes the texts.

Web expert; person who looks for information on the internet.

Time expert; person who makes sure everything happens in time.

  • You all have to tell something about your topic during the presentation.
  • If you have any questions ask your teacher.

1. Group work of four students.

2. Each group is divided in two pairs.

3. Each pair fills in one quiz.

4. All groups use the same two quizzes about London.

5. Each group chooses one topic to present.

6. Division of roles in making the group presentation

7. Each group member presents a small part of presentation.

Quiz 1

History and general information on London

1) Go to; Bridge .

There is a river in London with lots of bridges crossing over. Answer the following questions.

  1. What is the name of the river in London?
  2. How many bridges are there?
  3. What is the oldest bridge?
  4. Which is the most famous bridge?

2) How many people live in London? Look at; Habitants London

  1. 1,300,000
  2. 4,800,000
  3. 7,500,000

3) A long time ago there was a great fire. Almost all of the city burned. The fire lasted for six days. When was is?

For hints look at; Great fire

4) England has a couple of famous writers. Think of J.K. Rowling (Harry Potter) and Shakespeare. Can you name one of Shakespeare's plays, which you might have seen as a film? For ideas; Shakespeare plays .

Quiz 2

Tourist information

1) When you go to London you can travel through London in several ways. Can you think of 5? For help go to Ways to travel .

2) There are a lot of activities in London. Choose three you would like to do and write down why you would like to do those activities. For ideas go to Things to do .

3) There are some typical English dishes. Have you ever heard over "spotted dick"? Can you tell what the following dishes are?

Bangers and Mash

Spotted Dick

Ploughman's lunch

For some help go to; Food

4) London is also famous for its shops and markets. Look at shops and markets and choose at least three shopping areas and/or markets that you would like to visit when you are in London. Also write down why you want to visit those shops and markets.

This quality will be judged upon:

- as an individual for:

  • Speaking skills (Accuracy, Fluency, Pronunciation, Comprehensibility)
  • Participation

The final mark for each individual is Group mark 1 + Individual mark 2 + individual mark given by each group member 3 divided through 3.

1

After this webquest you will know much more about London, its history, its culture, the interesting places to visit and the activities to do. So when you go to London you will be well prepared for your trip.

This is everything you learn when you do this webquest the way your supposed to do it:

  • The history and culture of London
  • The use of the internet to collect information
  • To communicate within a group
  • How to use your creativity to present a topic
  • How to give a presentation
  • How to divide roles within a group

1. Introduction

This lesson is developed as part of a school trip to London. The lesson stimulates student to search and collect information about the city of London. Each group of students has to focus on one specific topic about London. There are two quizes that stimulates and supports students to find all the relevant information. Students are free to focus on one specific topic.

However it has to be related to the school trip. The goal of the first part is that students learn how to collect and find the relevant information on the internet, how to exchange the information within the group, and last but not least how to transform it into a crispy and clear presentation.

The second goal of the task is that students learn how to divide tasks within the group about who presents what on which way and of course to present the information about the investigated topic to their classmates.

2. Learners

The grade level of this lesson is VMBO class 2 BB. So it is rather basic. It doesn't need any specific knowledge other than some basic skills about the use of internet, group work and how to make a presentation using a poster, flipover or PowerPoint.

3. Curriculum Standards

As a result of this lesson student will learn more about:

  • The history and culture of London
  • The use of the internet to collect information
  • To cummunicate within a group
  • How to use their creativity to present a topic
  • How to give a presentation
  • How to divide roles within a group

4. Process

The lesson consist out of three lesson hours. The advice is to give these lessons in the same week, one lesson a day. On that way the information stays fresh and students are more motivated to collect extra information at home.

  • · The first hour is for explaining the task and to search the internet using the quizzes.
  • · The second hour is to exchange the information within the group, to divide roles and to prepare the presentation.
  • · The third lesson is for presenting the topic in front of the class.

The different steps:

  1. 1. Group work of four students.

Teacher puts list with names of the groups on the black board.

The strong and weaker students are mixed.

If necessary one or two groups of five are made.

  1. 2. Each group is divided in two pairs.

The division in pairs is up to the students.

  1. 3. Each pair fills in one quiz.

Each pair of a group fills in one of the two quizzes. The quiz is no goal on itself but just a stimulus to search the web with a specific information need. First define your information need, than search the net. A golden rule for efficient use of the internet.

  1. 4. All groups use the same two quizzes about London.

The two pairs within one group exchange the information they found on the net. The questions of the quiz can be the tool for exchanging this information efficiently and effective about he different topics they studied.

  1. 5. Each group chooses one topic to present'.

The group has to decide which topic they are going to present. Of course this should be an interesting topic but also the topic they found a lot of relevant and presentable information on the net. It is very important that students learn to focus on a specific part in the presentation. Make sure they define their topic.

  1. 6. Division of roles.

The division of roles is important for the task in total.

The roles are:

  • Design expert; person who design the poster or PowerPoint presentation
  • Language expert; person who writes the texts
  • Web expert; person who looks for information on the internet
  • Time expert; person who controls the time schedule

The presentation has to be divided among all four students. So all of them get the opportunity to present their part in front of the class.

  1. 5. Presentation.

The presentation itself is the final product of the group work.

The maximum time for the presentation is 5 minutes presentation followed by some few minutes for questions. After every ten minutes a new group starts to present.

Adjust your classroom organization for this lesson.

Make a time schedule for this part of the lesson.

  1. 6. Resources needed.

Material

  • Computers with access to internet
  • Flipovers
  • Pencils
  • Beamer for PowerPoint presentation
  • Poster material
